alert.note: Alert for Malheur County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:26PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Owyhee and east central Malheur Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 325 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sheaville, or 37 miles southwest of Nampa, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Succor Creek Reservoir and Malloy Ranch around 340 PM MDT. Rockville School around 350 PM MDT. Squaw Butte and Rockville around 400 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
